Offspring of Venus, power supreme!</br>Thou tyrant of the human breast!</br>Whose feather'd darts, in wild extreme,</br>To misery consign the best.</br>Once in thy silken flowery chain,</br>'Twas sweet content, unmix'd with pain;</br>No tortur'd slaves were heard to groan,</br>Nor plaintive sounds of woe — but murmuring sighs alone.

Virtue, Jove's darling child, by fate</br>Ordain'd o'er favour'd man to reign,</br>And thou, her happy chosen mate;</br>Till vice appear'd, true passion's bane,</br>Seduc'd from virtue's gentle sway,</br>See lawless love to vice a prey,</br>Whose favours to the good appears</br>Misery, compar'd with virtue's very tears.

Dejected virtue quits the plain,</br>With ev'ry soft attractive grace,</br>Which erst compos'd her sportive train;</br>Sweet modesty, with blushing face,</br>And sacred truth, celestial maid,</br>And innocence in white array'd,</br>Bright honour in transparent vest,</br>And wisdom marching grave — now in sable drest.

Specious deceit, with aspect bland,</br>Tempts thee to distant roseat bow'rs,</br>By fiction rais'd with artful hand,</br>To deck vain misery with flow'rs,</br>Lo!  to fill up thy hideous train,</br>Revenge assuming honour's mein,</br>Envy and thoughtless vanity,</br>Remorse, despair, wild rage and black hypocrisy.

Thou sought the rose, but feel'st the thorn,</br>Th' illusions gradually dissolve;</br>Thy lab'ring breast, with anguish torn,</br>Virtue's lost charms and woes revolve;</br>Hope cries, "thy heavenly queen regain,</br>Sue her return, nor sue in vain."</br>Instant she comes with chasten'd joy,</br>Mild pity, soft content, and sweet tranquility.

Oh!  Cupid, may this matchless dame,</br>With gentle hand thy fateful dart,</br>Temper'd in Hymen's sacred flame,</br>Speed to my unresisting heart,</br>(Not wounded by the hand obscene</br>Of vice — or folly light and vain)</br>So shall thy suppliant ever prove</br>Through life the vot'ry true of virtuous love.</br>
